```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}

library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(janitor)

```

```{r}

# Read in and clean up data to combine separate year files to one df

tins_2010 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2010.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>%  
  select(-c(29, 30, 32)) %>% 
  head(212) 

tins_2011 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2011.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c"))%>% 
  select(-c(29, 30, 32)) 

tins_2012 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2012.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c"))

tins_2013 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2013.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c"))
 
tins_2014 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2014.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c"))
 
tins_2015 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2015.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>% 
  select(-c(25:27)) %>% 
  rename("NOTE?" = "Comment")
 
tins_2016 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2016.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>% 
  select(-c(25:27)) %>% 
  head(778) %>% 
  rename("NOTE?" = "Comment")

tins_2017 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2017.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>% 
  head(167) %>% 
  rename("NOTE?" = "Comment")
 
tins_2018 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2018.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>% 
  head(200) %>% 
  rename("NOTE?" = "Comment")
 
tins_2019 <- read_csv(here("RawData", "2019.csv"), 
                      col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>% 
  head(29) %>% 
  rename("NOTE?" = "Comment")

tins <- bind_rows(tins_2010,
                  tins_2011,
                  tins_2012,
                  tins_2013,
                  tins_2014,
                  tins_2015,
                  tins_2016,
                  tins_2017,
                  tins_2018,
                  tins_2019)

```

```{r}

# Tidy tins

tins_tidy <- tins %>% 
  clean_names() %>% 
  mutate(wing = as.numeric(wing),
         wght = as.numeric(wght))

```
